newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE world sugar was called to open mostly flat on Friday, dealers said.
The expiry of the July contract is expected to remain orderly, with activity seen focused on the July/October spread in the near term. The spread narrowed to 0.04 cent on Thursday, from 0.05 cent.
"We are seeing a very slow liquidation that looks orderly," a trader said. "The specs seem comfortable and there is no pressure on them."

Thursday, the July contract closed up 0.01 at 11.37 cents per lb, traded 11.38 to 11.30 cents on Thursday. Most-active October settled 0.02 cent firmer at 11.33 cents, while the rest of the board closed 0.01 and 0.02 cent higher.
LIFFE spot August white sugar futures were thinly traded on Friday, with the spot August contract unchanged at $323.30, at 0850 EDT/1250 GMT.
The rest of the board was trading $0.10 to $0.40 weaker.
